episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and surprising facts, including the unexpected comparison between human and horse long jump records, Alfred Hitchcock's peculiar tea-drinking habit, Romanian idioms, and the unusual use of foreskins in medical procedures.

facts.fact: The world record for horse long jump is shorter than the world record for human long jump.
Every time Alfred Hitchcock had a cup of tea, he always smashed the tea cup.
The Romanian equivalent of comparing apples and oranges is you're comparing grandmothers and machine guns.
Replacement eyelids can be made from foreskins.
